title: Cross Route-to-Market Programs Manager
summary: The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. Apple’s Sales organization generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This in turn, enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Our sales team, is in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers. Apple is looking for a very strong Program Manager to create and implement in-store initiatives that will apply across all our Route to Market to drive sales and customer experience. The Program manager will cover the program design, development and delivery of go-to-market strategies of these initiatives. They will be working with a variety of cross functional partners including Staff & Training, In Store Technologies, Product Marketing, Finance, Digital and Merchandising to name a few. These initiatives will be designed to apply across tens of thousands of point of sales of our Consumer Electronic retailers, our Carrier partners, and Apple-only resellers across the world. The XRTM Program Manager is a strategic problem solver and organized teammate. They will drive, project manage and deliver against key initiatives in our channel programs globally, focusing on Security and in-store customer experiences. They will activate on device apps and content, merchandising and staff and connect them with channel partner digital touch points with consumers. The work will include but is not limited to collecting external market research, defining program scope, identifying key deliverables, writing and developing operational program content, working with a cross-functional team to develop full program deliverables, project managing the plan of record, establishing metrics, and tracking deployment and KPIs. This is a critical position with colleagues who depend on your reliability, accuracy, attention to detail and high-quality work. This position also includes other ad hoc projects to support the business on an as needed basis.
description: Building and articulating strong cases and strategies around Security, Online to Offline consumer retail strategies and using existing in-store platform for showcasing customer experiences (assisted and unassisted) across multiple route to markets Creating comprehensive program plans and establishing a plan of record and managing the whole lifecycle of the project across design, development, delivery and deployment. Conducting & Collecting external market research to support strategies. Gather internal and external best practices. Drafting program communications Following up and communicating with all parties involved in a project, which may include Cross-functional global teams and teams in regions around the world, to keep projects on track Providing regular updates to business owners and company executives Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting quantitative and qualitative data Creating reports and presentations to show both strategies, program status’ and results Completing ad hoc business projects, which may include analytics
preferred_qualifications: Experience in effectively managing multiple cross-functional projects simultaneously Previous experience in setting sales or retail strategy Experience working with Security and Loss Prevention organizations Ability to create a phenomenal customer and partner experience Ability to stay on top of details while maintaining a big picture view, have a sense of urgency, and follow-through Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills Experience working in a fast-paced environment, ability to adapt quickly and think creatively Proficient in Excel and Keynote Excellent collaboration and relationship building skills
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $179,000 and $269,100, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation.
